Marissa Taylor EXPERIENCE COORDINATOR Focus: program and event support; start-up onboarding, hospitality + concierge 616.772.5226                        ext. ext. 204 + Marissa Taylor EXPERIENCE COORDINATOR Focus: program and event support; start-up onboarding, hospitality + concierge Education: Western Michigan University Interests: Live music, art, and sports – football, basketball, and soccer. About: Marissa’s primary background is in retail and customer service. Previous employment includes having had the pleasure of working for West Michigan companies such as New Holland Brewing Company and Gordon Food Services. Her experience in customer service, hospitality, and account management make her the ideal Experience Coordinator for our SURGE Program and the needs of the Next Center.  Outside of work, she loves creating art, gardening, DIY projects, and traveling LinkedIn Call Marissa Jean Ellis ADMINISTRATIVE ASSISTANT Focus: Leading efforts in scheduling and maintaining communications of leadership 616.772.5226                         ext. 217 + Jean Ellis ADMINISTRATIVE ASSISTANT Focus: Leading efforts in scheduling and maintaining communications of leadership ADMINISTRATRIVE ASSISTANT Education: Christchurch Polytechnic Institute of Technology Interests: cooking, baking ABOUT Jean is responsible for supporting the Lakeshore Advantage board of directors and board committees as well as for scheduling and meeting support for the Lakeshore Advantage leadership team. Jean joined the team in 2025 after several years of experience in sales, customer support, and hospitality. LinkedIn Call Jean Angela Huesman CHIEF OPERATING OFFICER Focus: Implements strategies, manages day-to-day operations 616.772.5226                        ext. 209 + Angela Huesman CHIEF OPERATING OFFICER Focus: Implements strategies, manages day-to-day operations CHIEF OPERATING OFFICER angela.huesman@lakeshoreadvantage.com (616) 772-5226 ext. 209 Education: Baker College, B.S., Business Administration Interests: Cooking, gardening, traveling and spending time with my family. ABOUT Angela serves as the Chief Operating Officer at Lakeshore Advantage. She implements organizational strategy and manages the day-to-day operations, internal human resource needs, financial management, and board governance. Angela also represents the voice of business growth needs in the community through service on the Ready for School board, West Michigan Works! workforce development board, Hello West Michigan advisory board, and as a member of the Discover Manufacturing leadership team. Prior to her current role, Angela spent over a decade in corporate relocation services for Coldwell Banker Schmidt companies working with area employers to attract and retain talent. LinkedIn Call Angela Sara Little MARKETING MANAGER Focus: Event Development and Execution, Marketing Campaigns, Social Media Strategy 616.772.5226                        ext. ext. 221 + Sara Little MARKETING MANAGER Focus: Event Development and Execution, Marketing Campaigns, Social Media Strategy Contact: Sara.Little@lakeshoreadvantage.com; (616) 772-5226 ext. 221 Education: Purdue University, B.S., Psychology Interests: Cooking, traveling, family time, exploring hidden gems in West Michigan, and deep dives into anything random on Wikipedia. About: Sara serves as the Marketing Manager at Lakeshore Advantage. In her role, Sara is responsible for event planning, social media, and digital asset production. Prior to her current role, Sara spent 20+ years developing her marketing career in the hospitality industry across Napa + Sonoma in a variety of roles, from event programs to marketing strategies and community development. LinkedIn Call Sara Grace Maiullo DIRECTOR OF MARKETING & COMMUNICATIONS Focus: Marketing & communications 616.772.5226                        ext. 203 + Grace Maiullo DIRECTOR OF MARKETING & COMMUNICATIONS Focus: Marketing & communications Education: Lake Forest College, B.A., Biology; Anthropology Interests: Family, running, yoga, hiking, reading ABOUT Grace is the Director of Marketing & Communications. In her role, she serves as lead storyteller for Lakeshore Advantage, managing media and public relations, content creation, and event production. Grace joined the team in 2022 with over ten years of experience in donor, sponsor, and member engagement within the nonprofit sector. Grace started her career in 2010 working for a trade association and gained extensive experience with investor engagement through event production and strategic communications aimed at building awareness and garnering community support for organizational missions at the Grand Rapids Art Museum and Special Olympics Michigan. LinkedIn Call Grace Beth Blanton VICE PRESIDENT OF ENGAGEMENT Focus: Investor relations 616.772.5226                        ext. 205 + Beth Blanton VICE PRESIDENT OF ENGAGEMENT Focus: Investor relations VICE PRESIDENT OF ENGAGEMENT beth.blanton@lakeshoreadvantage.com (616) 772-5226 ext. 205 Education: Hope College, B.A., Business Administration, Communication Interests: Exploring Michigan, antiquing, time with family and friends, learning to golf Accolades: Holland Young Professional Community Matters Nominee (2016) ABOUT Beth built her professional and leadership skills through her experience at various organizations, including the Grand Rapids Area Chamber of Commerce, Fleetwood Group Inc., and the City of Holland, Michigan. These experiences, spanning the private, public and nonprofit sectors prepared her for a leadership role at Lakeshore Advantage, where she began in 2016. Beth serves as the Vice President of Engagement where she is responsible for growing investor engagement and partnerships. Her responsibilities include setting and executing all new revenue and fundraising initiatives to fully fund the organization’s operating budget, leading the engagement team, and setting the strategic direction and vision for events and sponsorship opportunities. Beth currently serves on the West Michigan Regional Airport Authority Board and the City of Zeeland Brownfield Board. LinkedIn Call Beth Lindsay Maunz PROJECT MANAGER Focus: Fostering community growth 616.772.5226                        ext. ext. 305 + Lindsay Maunz PROJECT MANAGER Focus: Fostering community growth Contact: Lindsay.Maunz@lakeshoreadvantage.com; (616) 772-5226 ext. 305 Education: Saint Louis University, MPH, Behavioral Science and Health Education and Epidemiology; Central Michigan University, B.S., Community Health Education and Childhood Development Interests: Baking, hiking, and snuggling with her dog About: Lindsay is a Project Manager for the Strategic Initiatives team at Lakeshore Advantage. In her role, Lindsay spearheads vital projects to advance strategic goals and foster community growth. She is responsible for researching and writing grant funding applications, grant administration, and managing communications and project timelines with key stakeholders. Lindsay brings several years of experience in public administration. Before joining Lakeshore Advantage, Lindsay held positions at Allegan County as the planning and preparedness manager and public health specialist/public information officer. LinkedIn Call Lindsay Kelly Wandel DIRECTOR OF TALENT INITIATIVES Focus: Talent strategy, next generation workforce pathways, collaborative strategic partnerships 616.772.5226                        ext. 222 + Kelly Wandel DIRECTOR OF TALENT INITIATIVES Focus: Talent strategy, next generation workforce pathways, collaborative strategic partnerships Education: Davenport University, Master of Business Administration; Grand Valley State University, BS, Biomedical Science Interests: Coaching West Ottawa basketball, skiing, playing volleyball, spending time with her white lab, and traveling with her husband and two daughters. ABOUT As Director of Talent Initiatives, Kelly leads efforts to strengthen the regional workforce by aligning talent strategies with the needs of our Lakeshore region. She collaborates with employers, educators, and workforce partners to develop innovative programs that attract, develop, and retain talent across the region. With a focus on data-driven solutions and inclusive practices, Kelly works to ensure a resilient and competitive workforce that supports long-term economic growth. Kelly joined the Lakeshore Advantage team in 2025, bringing 19 years of experience in higher education and workforce development. Prior to her role with Lakeshore Advantage, Kelly served as Partnership Manager at Davenport University where she led the development of strategic partnerships with businesses, K–12 schools, community colleges, and local organizations to enhance workforce pathways and build a more resilient talent pipeline in the healthcare sector. LinkedIn Call Kelly Mandy Cooper VICE PRESIDENT OF STRATEGIC INITIATIVES Focus: Leads on projects that involve partners who support business growth in our community 616.772.5226                        ext. 202 + Mandy Cooper VICE PRESIDENT OF STRATEGIC INITIATIVES Focus: Leads on projects that involve partners who support business growth in our community VICE PRESIDENT OF STRATEGIC INITIATIVES mandy.cooper@lakeshoreadvantage.com (616) 772-5226 ext. 202 Education: Calvin College, B.A., Communications Interests: Spending time with her husband and two dogs at their rustic cabin up north ABOUT As Vice President of Strategic Initiatives, Mandy partners with federal, state, and local units of government along with civic and community organizations to advance economic initiatives in the Lakeshore region. Her work includes advancing talent and education initiatives as well as other major economic initiatives involving multiple stakeholders. Mandy participates in numerous community boards. Mandy joined the team in 2018 with 20 years of experience working with organizations in the Holland/Zeeland community, first as an executive vice president for marketing and communications firm, The Image Group, then as Director of Advancement at Zeeland Christian Schools where she led a $5.4 million capital campaign. LinkedIn Call Mandy Nora VandenBrink DIRECTOR OF SURGE PARTNERSHIPS Focus: Entrepreneurial support, early-stage fundraising strategy, strategic partnerships 616.772.5226                        ext. 212 + Nora VandenBrink DIRECTOR OF SURGE PARTNERSHIPS Focus: Entrepreneurial support, early-stage fundraising strategy, strategic partnerships DIRECTOR OF SURGE PARTNERSHIPS nora.vandenbrink@lakeshoreadvantage.com (616) 772-5226 ext. 212 Education: Loyola Marymount University, B.A., Psychology, Studio Art Interests: Cooking and anything culinary related, stand-up paddle boarding, problem-solving ABOUT Nora serves as the Director of SURGE Partnerships. In her role, Nora will focus on cultivating ecosystem growth through the stewardship and development of corporate, community and investor partnerships. Nora connects SURGE startups and founders with a wide range of resources and partner organizations to support the development and growth of their businesses. Prior to joining Lakeshore Advantage, Nora honed her entrepreneurial expertise as the Associate Director of Startup Engagement and Venture Capital Programs at The University of Chicago’s Polsky Center for Entrepreneurship and Innovation. She first began cultivating her entrepreneurial toolkit in her role as Marketing Coordinator at Yoobi, a social enterprise startup based in Los Angeles, CA. In this role, Rebekah focuses on data integrity of primary data as well as the reporting and analysis of secondary data for research conducted by Lakeshore Advantage to gain insights into the region’s business trends. Rebekah has served on a local school board since 2016, where she contributes leadership skills and a unique viewpoint on flexible learning and innovative student experiences. Before joining Lakeshore Advantage, Rebekah worked as a registered nurse for nearly 10 years with experience in critical care and hospice care. Rebekah maintains an active Michigan license as a Registered Nurse. LinkedIn Call Rebekah Amanda Murray VICE PRESIDENT OF BUSINESS SOLUTIONS Focus: Business attraction and expansion; commercial/industrial real estate relationships 616.772.5226                        ext. 302 + Amanda Murray VICE PRESIDENT OF BUSINESS SOLUTIONS Focus: Business attraction and expansion; commercial/industrial real estate relationships VICE PRESIDENT OF BUSINESS SOLUTIONS amanda.murray@lakeshoreadvantage.com (616) 772-5226 ext. 302 Education: University of Wisconsin-Madison, M.S., Urban and Regional Planning Washington State University, B.A., Business Administration Interests: Traveling, playing tennis, spending time with her husband and two boys Accolades: Michiana’s 40 Under 40 (2012) ABOUT Amanda serves as the Vice President of Business Solutions. In this role, Amanda leads the team that focuses on business attraction, retention, and expansion efforts, along with entrepreneurship programming. Amanda joined the team in 2016 with over 10 years of experience working in economic development. Prior to her current role, Amanda held the position of Vice President of Economic Development in the Nashville, Tennessee region. She also previously worked at Purdue University where she worked with communities throughout the state assisting with economic development projects, entrepreneurship, workforce development and strategic planning. LinkedIn Call Amanda Jennifer Owens PRESIDENT Focus: Vision and strategy-setting for the organization 616.772.5226                        ext. 304 + Jennifer Owens PRESIDENT Focus: Vision and strategy-setting for the organization Education: The University of Southern Mississippi, EDMP, Economic Development Leadership University of Notre Dame, Executive Management Certification Michigan State University, B.A., Journalism Interests: Family, entertaining, boating, traveling Accolades: Top 50 Economic Developers in the U.S. – Consultant Connect 200 Most Influential Leaders in Grand Rapids 50 Most Influential Women in West Michigan Corp Magazine Most Valuable Professional Economic Development Newsmaker of the Year ABOUT As President of Lakeshore Advantage, Jennifer is responsible for setting the vision and strategy of the organization. Jennifer delivers direct business attraction, expansion, and retention services while providing overall leadership to the organization. Since joining Lakeshore Advantage in 2013, she has successfully landed numerous major business expansion and attraction projects. Jennifer has more than 20 years of leadership experience in marketing, communications, business retention, expansion, and attraction working in various state and local economic development positions throughout Michigan. Prior to joining Lakeshore Advantage, Jennifer held leadership positions at Southwest Michigan First and Consultant Connect. In addition, Jennifer held key positions at Ann Arbor SPARK and the Michigan Economic Development Corporation. About Us – Ocoee Lakeshore Center Call Us 407-877-5803 125 N Lakeshore Drive, Ocoee Florida Reservations@ocoee.org Follow Us ABOUT US EVENTS VENUE Lakeshore Center Withers Maguire House Outdoor Options Ison Center GALLERY BLOG CONTACT SCHEDULE TOUR ABOUT US EVENTS VENUE Lakeshore Center Withers Maguire House Outdoor Options Ison Center GALLERY BLOG CONTACT SCHEDULE TOUR ABOUT US THE OCOEE LAKESHORE CENTER The Ocoee Lakeshore Center was designed by event planners for event planners. They know what important aspects are needed for a seamless event and made sure that the facility was top of the line. The building was newly constructed in 2014 and after its great success and many events, it was expanded in 2019 to be able to accommodate larger events. The Center can support multiple events across several rooms, or large events up to 400 people in a single room. It also features a smaller venue, the Lakeview Room, which can accommodate up to 112 persons in banquet seating Our expanded facility, state-of-the-art audio visual equipment, commercial kitchen, dance floor, and great amenities make us the perfect place to hold your wedding, corporate event, sweet 16, quinceañera, class reunion, prom, graduation, performances, retirement party, musical event or any other reason you may have to celebrate! Virtual Tour Take a virtual tour of our main event area of the Ocoee Lakeshore Center. Drag your mouse to see different angles, click through doorways to make your way through the different rooms, and even use the measurement mode to get exact measurements anywhere in the facility! Frequently Asked Questions How far in advance can I book a rental? The Ocoee Lakeshore Center can be booked 18 months in advance. Reservations are open to the public on the first business day of the month. (Ex. You can book December 13, 2026 on June 1, 2025) Are my rates subject to change once I’ve signed a contract? Signed contracts 12-18 months prior to the event date are subject to an increase of 10% or less of your contracted rate. If your rental is within 364 days your contracted rate will not change. What is the process for reserving a rental space? Reserving a rental requires you to fill out a Facility Use Application with Parks and Recreation personnel. Rentals are on a first come first serve basis and require a 50% of the rental rate to secure your date. The remaining 50% balance and damage deposit is due 30 days prior to the Event date. When can I come by to make my reservation and sign my contract? Facility Use Applications must be signed in person Monday through Friday, 9:30am to 4:00pm by appointment. Please call ahead to schedule tours and to check staff availability. (407) 877-5803 Can you pencil me in for a rental? Courtesy holds may be accepted and are held for a maximum of seven (7) days. At that time, it is not guaranteed that Parks and Recreation staff will call you prior to your courtesy hold expiration. Courtesy holds can be made in person or by phone. Unfortunately, seven day holds do not apply to reopened dates due to cancellations. Is there a Damage or Security Deposit in addition to my rental charge? A Damage Deposit of $750 is required for all rentals of the Ocoee Lakeshore Center How late can I stay? Your event must end and all guests must vacate the premises by the end of your rental time. We do not rent past 12 a.m. What if we’re having a great time and stay later than our rental period? You will be charged the standard hourly rate for any time that you are in the building past your rental period. There is no discount unless it is booked beforehand in your contract. No events can pass 12 a.m. Can I choose my own vendors? All vendors must have insurance and submitted to OLC staff to be approved by the City of Ocoee. The kitchen is available for chilling or warming food and storing only. Will I receive a refund if we leave early? No refunds will be given. Please follow your contract time accordingly. Can I have a DJ or band in the Grand Ballroom for my reception? Yes. The DJ must be a registered and approved vendor. The City of Ocoee has a standing noise ordinance which will be provided to the DJ/band. Can I have music outside on the patio and/or Events Center? Written approval from the Parks and Recreation Department is required for any music to be played outdoors. Can I have items delivered, such as from my caterer, florist, DJ, etc? You must arrange for your deliveries to occur during your rental period. If you need to get in earlier, you must adjust your eight hour block to appropriately include the time you wish to enter. Delivery is available through the main building entrances unless otherwise noted. Do not block building entrances. Parks and Recreation staff are not authorized to sign for your deliveries, so you must provide an authorized person to sign for any deliveries; and due to space and security concerns, items cannot be stored for your event. Can I come anytime and view the building, to meet my caterer or florist, etc? Please contact the Parks and Recreation Department office at (407) 877-5803 to make your appointment, reschedule or cancel an event, or for additional facility information. When do I hold my ceremony rehearsal? A one hour block for rehearsals is included in your Rental Rate. Rehearsals may be scheduled 30 days in advance and must take place Monday – Thursday (excluding Holidays) between 8:00am and 4:30pm based on availability. Can my flower girl throw rose petals? Only natural flower petals are permitted in the plaza. All other loose objects like rice (including puffed rice or biodegradable rice), birdseed, silk flower petals, confetti, glitter or other similar materials (i.e. such as pearls, crystals, rhinestones, etc.) may not be used inside or outside the Ocoee Lakeshore Center. Bubbles are only permitted outside. Can I use sparklers for my wedding exit? Sparklers are permitted outside of the Ocoee Lakeshore Center for your exit. However, all sparklers must be disposed of properly meaning the used sparklers must be discarded in a bucket or water or sand provided by the Renter. Failure to dispose of sparklers properly will result in a loss of the Damage Deposit. How may I decorate? Decorations are permitted within reason. They must be approved by the Parks and Recreation staff no less than ten (10) days prior to your event and must be removed at the conclusion of your event. Decorations may not be affixed to the walls, doors, windows, window coverings, painted surfaces or hung from the ceiling. The use of tape, tacks, nails, staples, etc. are not permitted to attach your decorations. Fog/smoke machines, dry ice, and/ or open flames are not permitted. However, the use of candles enclosed in glass, such as votive and hurricane lamps may be permitted with prior approval. Rice, birdseed, silk flower petals, glitter, confetti, or other similar decorations are prohibited. The use of helium balloons are allowed in the Ocoee Lakeshore Center, however, if helium balloons become detached from a display, the labor cost to retrieve the balloons will be charged to the renter. Can I serve alcohol? All alcoholic beverages must be served via your select caterer. Please contact your select caterer to learn their policies and procedures regarding alcohol service. A copy of the liquor liability binder must be submitted 30 days prior to the event date. If the event is reserved in less than 30 days, the renter has 5 days from the contract date to summit the liquor liability binder, otherwise forfeits the privilege and incurs a $25 fee. The City of Ocoee supports responsible drinking at all times. How many parking spaces are available? The Ocoee Lakeshore Center can accommodate 117 vehicles. Overflow parking is available for larger groups if necessary. Schedule a Tour Now About Us The expanded Ocoee Lakeshore Center and the surrounding greens are a space for you to come together to celebrate life’s special events, spend time with those you love, and meet new neighbors. We have space for all of life’s special occasions. Our expanded facility, state-of-the-art audio visual equipment, commercial kitchen, dressing suites, and great amenities make us the perfect place to hold your wedding, corporate event, Sweet 16, quinceañera, class reunion, prom, graduation, performances, retirement party, musical event or any other reason you may have to celebrate! The Lakeshore Center can support multiple events across several rooms, or large events up to 400 people in a single room. It also features a smaller space, the Lakeview Room, which can accommodate up to 112 persons in banquet seating. If you’re considering an outdoor ceremony, our Wedding Garden is a perfect fit for your needs. This shaded arbor has been designed with an intimate garden surrounding it, ideal for a private and picturesque weddings. If you have any questions or would like to schedule a tour, please contact the reservations office at (407) 877-5803. All bookings for use of the Ocoee Lakeshore Center are taken at the Parks and Recreation Department Offices, located at City Hall, 175 N. Bluford Ave, between the hours of 8:30 a.m. and 4:30 p.m., Monday through Friday. The Parks and Recreation Department takes bookings up to 18 months in advance. We look forward to celebrating with you! This site is protected by reCAPTCHA and the Google Privacy Policy and Terms of Service apply. Gallery Upcoming Events Frequently Asked Questions What is the average price range for venue rental? The rates for our weekend eight-hour rental blocks range from $2,000 to $3,200 depending on the day of the week and the space within the facility you require for your guest count.  The rates for our weekday six-hour rental blocks (Monday – Thursday) range from $1,000 to $1,500. All rentals must also pay a refundable damage deposit of $750, collected thirty days before your event. What is included in that cost? The Lakeshore Center provides tables, chairs, and basic audio/visual support. All rentals, regardless of size, have access to the pre-function space, lobby, two dressing suites, and caterer’s kitchen. Additionally, we have three rolling bars available for use by licensed and insured bartenders. Is there a minimum for booking? We require payment of 50% of your total rental costs to confirm a reservation. What other types of events does the venue host? The Lakeshore Center hosts corporate events, fundraisers, birthday parties, baby showers, quinceañeras, and much more! What gets you most excited about wedding day? We love watching our space transform into your perfect wedding location. Best piece of advice for couples planning a wedding. Hiring an event planner or day-of coordinator to handle the details can help you and your loved ones enjoy each moment of your special day. Do you require vendors from a pre-approved list? No, you are welcome to select any vendor of your choosing so long as they can provide their license and liability insurance for approval by the City of Ocoee. Ocoee Lakeshore Center: A Year of Unforgettable Events – Ocoee Lakeshore Center ABOUT US EVENTS VENUE Lakeshore Center Withers Maguire House Outdoor Options Ison Center GALLERY BLOG CONTACT SCHEDULE TOUR ABOUT US EVENTS VENUE Lakeshore Center Withers Maguire House Outdoor Options Ison Center GALLERY BLOG CONTACT SCHEDULE TOUR Ocoee Lakeshore Center > Ocoee Lakeshore Center Ballrooms > Ocoee Lakeshore Center: A Year of Unforgettable Events Ocoee Lakeshore Center: A Year of Unforgettable Events December 20, 2024 by beatcreative 0 likes 2024 has been a year filled with vibrant energy and unforgettable moments at Ocoee Lakeshore Center. From electrifying music festivals to heartwarming community gatherings, our venue has played host to a diverse array of events that have brought joy, laughter, and inspiration to our community. Ocoee Music Fest One of the highlights of the year was undoubtedly the Ocoee Music Fest, a star-studded extravaganza featuring an incredible lineup of talent. Bret Michaels, Los Lonely Boys, Layla Brisbois Band, Michael Ray, Cooper Alan, Dion Pride, and John Ashley and the Tom Jackson Band delivered electrifying performances that had the crowd on their feet all night long. Jolly Jamboree The Jolly Jamboree was another resounding success, transforming our center into a winter wonderland. From mouthwatering food trucks to thrilling rides and games, there was something for everyone to enjoy. The highlight of the evening was undoubtedly the magical tree lighting ceremony, which filled the air with festive cheer. Ocoee Community Market The Ocoee Community Market, a new in 2024 monthly event, continued to thrive throughout the year. Held on the first Thursday of each month, the market showcased the talents of local artisans and vendors, offering a delightful array of handcrafted wares, delicious food truck fare, and lively family entertainment. Isabella and Mario’s Wedding Isabella and Mario’s wedding at Ocoee Lakeshore Center was a fairytale come true. The ceremony, held in the picturesque Wedding Garden, was a breathtaking affair. Soft music played as the bride, escorted by her father, walked down the aisle adorned with delicate mauve and blush pink florals. The exchange of vows was filled with emotion, and the couple sealed their love with a tender kiss. The reception, held in the grand ballroom, was a vibrant celebration with dancing, laughter, and unforgettable memories. A Tapestry of Events Beyond these signature events, Ocoee Lakeshore Center has also been the proud host of many other memorable occasions. The Easter Eggstravaganza brought smiles to the faces of children of all ages, while the Asian Cultural Festival offered a captivating glimpse into the rich tapestry of Asian culture through music, dance, and delectable cuisine. The GiveLight Foundation and Human Concern USA hosted an inspiring evening at our center, celebrating Palestinian culture and raising vital funds to support those in need. Similarly, Matthew’s Hope successfully hosted their “Roaring Twenties” fundraiser, bringing the community together to address the growing homelessness crisis in our area. More Than A Venue Ocoee Lakeshore Center is more than just a venue; it’s a cherished space for life’s most important milestones. From intimate gatherings to grand celebrations, we offer a diverse range of spaces to suit any event. Our main Lakeshore Center boasts a spacious ballroom overlooking Starke Lake, perfect for large weddings, corporate events, and community gatherings. For a touch of history and intimacy, the Withers-Maguire House provides a charming setting. Outdoor options abound, including the picturesque Wedding Garden, expansive Bill Breeze Park, and the shaded Outdoor Garden, offering idyllic settings for ceremonies and receptions. Finally, the Ison Center caters to smaller events with its cozy atmosphere and spacious outdoor plaza. Whether it’s a wedding, a family reunion, or a corporate retreat, Ocoee Lakeshore Center provides the perfect backdrop to create unforgettable memories that will last a lifetime. As we reflect on a year of incredible events, we are grateful for the support of our community and the opportunity to serve as a vibrant hub for entertainment, culture, and community engagement. We look forward to continuing to create unforgettable experiences at Ocoee Lakeshore Center in the years to come. Book your next event at Ocoee Lakeshore Center today and experience the magic for yourself! About Us | Ocoee, FL Skip to Main Content Search City of Ocoee Phone: 407-905-3100 1 North Bluford Avenue, Ocoee, FL 34761 About Us Events Programs Facilities Parks Community Relations Home City Government Departments Parks & Leisure Services About Us About Us The City of Ocoee Parks and Leisure Services Department strives to provide the citizens of Ocoee with safe and enjoyable programs, parks and facilities that will enhance the quality of life for city residents and promote an overall sense of community. We are committed to providing quality recreational services and welcome your comments, suggestions and ideas. Ocoee Lakeshore Center The Ocoee Lakeshore Center is West Orange County’s premier event destination. From wedding to conventions, the Lakeshore Center can host your event in style. Enjoy lovely lake views and modern amenities from all areas of our facility. The Lakeshore Center features banquet seating for more than 200 people, a modern catering kitchen, additional rooms for use and a state of the art audio-visual system. The historic Withers-Maguire House is suited for bridal party preparations and smaller meetings and events. For more information contact the Parks and Leisure Services Administrative office at 407-877-5803. Facilities The Parks and Leisure Services Department manages six recreation centers located throughout the city. A variety of programs for youth, adults and seniors are offered at these centers throughout the week. All centers are available during weekday evenings and on weekends to rent for family gatherings, parties, meetings, receptions, banquets and other special occasions. For more information contact the Parks and Leisure Services Administrative office at 407-877-5803. Parks The Parks and Leisure Services Department operates and maintains thirteen parks throughout the city with some of the following amenities: picnic areas, playgrounds, basketball and tennis courts, baseball, softball, football and soccer fields, and pavilions. Discover a park close to you. Programs The Parks and Leisure Services Department provides a variety of year-round recreational programs and events for youth , adults and seniors to enhance the quality of life for the residents of Ocoee. For more information on the programs and classes, please contact the Jim Beech Recreation Center at 407-905-3180 or check out our Facebook Page . Family Aquatic Center The Ocoee Family Aquatic Center provides a safe and relaxing setting for families to enjoy their day. Special features include a zero depth entry for easy access and spray features for the kids to splash the day away. For more information on programs and classes at the aquatic center, contact the Jim Beech Recreation Center at 407-905-3180. Ocoee Music Festival The City of Ocoee’s Fall Music Festival is celebrated annually drawing more than 20,000 people each year. The festival includes both local and national entertainment and one of the best fireworks displays in Central Florida. It is non-stop fun! For more information please contact Mark Johnson , Parks & Leisure Services Director or check the Festival website . Summer Wedding Tips from Ocoee Lakeshore Center – Ocoee Lakeshore Center ABOUT US EVENTS VENUE Lakeshore Center Withers Maguire House Outdoor Options Ison Center GALLERY BLOG CONTACT SCHEDULE TOUR ABOUT US EVENTS VENUE Lakeshore Center Withers Maguire House Outdoor Options Ison Center GALLERY BLOG CONTACT SCHEDULE TOUR Ocoee Lakeshore Center > Ocoee Lakeshore Center Tips & Tricks > Summer Wedding Tips from Ocoee Lakeshore Center Summer Wedding Tips from Ocoee Lakeshore Center May 20, 2024 by beatcreative 0 likes Planning a summer wedding in Florida can be an absolute dream – it’s a vacation destination filled with sunshine and beauty. But let’s face it, the Florida heat can also be a bit of a beast. Here at Ocoee Lakeshore Center, we’ve hosted countless summer weddings, and we’ve picked up a few tricks to keep your guests cool and comfortable while you tie the knot. Late Afternoon/Evening Ceremony First things first, consider having your ceremony outdoors in our beautiful wedding garden. An evening ceremony, closer to 6pm, can also be a great way to dodge the peak heat of the day. And of course, hydration is key! Set up a lemonade or water station. Another “cool” idea would be custom water bottles featuring your photo – it’s a detail your guests will appreciate, and those bottles will be a cute reminder of your special day. Wedding Fans We love the idea our bride had from a recent wedding – personalized fans featuring their photo and the date/city! These not only add a cute touch but also serve a practical purpose. Speaking of practicality, program fans are another great way to go. These two-sided fans combine the ceremony information and wedding party introductions with a built-in way for guests to cool down. Plus, it’s a keepsake they’ll use long after the ceremony is over! Sweet Treats to Keep Cool But what about sweet treats? Who doesn’t love ice cream on a hot day? Catering a gelato, ice cream, or snow cone truck adds a touch of fun and keeps your guests cool and happy. Local businesses offer truck rentals, and these add a touch of nostalgia to your wedding. Three 2 Oh – Liquid Nitrogen Ice Cream Tents & Umbrella Rentals Now, Florida is known for its afternoon showers, so it’s always wise to have a plan B. Luckily, there are tons of rental companies offering beautiful tents that allow you to maintain that outdoor feel while staying covered from the elements. Don’t worry, we can give you a list of our preferred vendors . Oh, and umbrellas! They’re not just functional for shade, but they can also add a touch of elegance to your décor (talk about some fun photo ops)! Dress Code: Cool Summer Attire When it comes to attire, let your guests know it’s a cool summer affair. Flowy dresses and sundresses are perfect for the occasion. For a fun twist, suggest a color scheme that’s bright, colorful, and tropical. We love a themed summer wedding that creates a cheerful and happy vibe. Escape the Heat But hey, if the heat does win and you need to move indoors, we’ve got you covered there too! Our Ballroom is perfect for larger receptions and ceremonies, while our Lakeview Room is ideal for more intimate gatherings. Let’s Make Your Dream Summer Wedding A Reality No matter what your plans are, here at Ocoee Lakeshore Center, we want to help you create a magical wedding day. With a little planning and some creative touches, your summer wedding can be both stylish and comfortable for you and your guests. So contact us today about your dream summer wedding – we can’t wait to help make it a reality! Withers-Maguire House – Ocoee Lakeshore Center Call Us 407-877-5803 125 N Lakeshore Drive, Ocoee Florida Reservations@ocoee.org Follow Us ABOUT US EVENTS VENUE Lakeshore Center Withers Maguire House Outdoor Options Ison Center GALLERY BLOG CONTACT SCHEDULE TOUR ABOUT US EVENTS VENUE Lakeshore Center Withers Maguire House Outdoor Options Ison Center GALLERY BLOG CONTACT SCHEDULE TOUR WITHERS-MAGUIRE HOUSE Withers-Maguire house The Withers – Maguire House, built in 1888, is one of Orange County’s oldest homes. It has been tastefully updated with an additional kitchen and restroom, while the main rooms of the house are much as they have always been. The Withers – Maguire house is suitable for smaller events, like club parties and rehearsal dinners, and includes bride and groom ready rooms that supplement other venues at the Center. The large wrap-around porch readily accommodates expansion of your event to the adjacent outdoor spaces for groups of more than 50 persons. Rich History This remarkable house was the first in Orange County to include closets in the bedrooms and electrical wiring inside the walls. The closets are still there, but the wiring is completely modern. Most lighting is indirect, allowing the rooms to retain many of the original fixtures. Details A catering kitchen with a large cooler and prep area has a separate back entrance. A central forced-air conditioning system has been tastefully installed so as to maintain the historic appearance of interior spaces. Ready Rooms Both Ready Rooms 1 and 2 in the Withers - Maguire House are available for use for wedding rentals; they are not part of the House that can be separately rented. Ready Room 1 Located on the first floor, Room 1 is used to serve as a preparation and recovery space for the bride and her wedding party. This room has a separate outside entrance on the east side of the House with a direct walkway to the Ocoee Lakeshore Center. Ready Room 2 Located on the second floor, is used to serve as the Groom’s preparation space and uses an isolated entrance to ensure the separation of bride and groom until after the wedding ceremony. Classic Withers-Maguire House Rental Rate $600 Friday/Saturday/Sunday $400 Monday – Thursday 6 Hour Block $350 Damage Deposit Event Space Separate Facility Spaces The Withers - Maguire house includes 2 separate facility spaces that may be used for your event consisting of the lawn and all the first floor spaces. Wedding Garden The Ocoee Wedding Garden features a wide area for ceremonies, bands, events and event participants. Nestled away from the lakeside area, this shaded arbor has been designed with an intimate garden surrounding it. This space is ideal for a private and picturesque wedding or reception. For more information, please contact us at 407-877-5803 for pricing and availability.
